features.title: Data Provenance Indicators
features.summary: Visual convention distinguishing Google Sheets data (unlabeled), AI assessments (purple), and live market data (cyan with freshness).
features.description:
Traders can now instantly identify the source of every data element on the portfolio pages.

**AI provenance (purple):** The AI Risk Assessment section on deal detail pages now has a purple left border and a small "AI" pill next to the heading. Discrepancy labels changed from yellow to purple ("AI: value") to align with the AI color convention. The Risk column header on the listing page also shows an "AI" pill since that column is entirely AI-sourced.

**Live market data (cyan with freshness):** Options sections show a "LIVE" pill during market hours or "PRIOR CLOSE" when markets are closed. The market data status dot is now freshness-aware: green when data is <90s old, amber when stale, gray when disconnected. The status label appends "(stale)" when amber. Live price text dims from cyan-400 to cyan-600 when data is stale (>5 minutes).

**Google Sheets data (unlabeled):** Sheet-sourced sections (Deal Terms, Key Dates, Deal Assessment, risk badges) remain unlabeled as the default baseline -- labeling them would add noise since they represent ~90% of the data.

**Pages affected:** /sheet-portfolio (listing), /sheet-portfolio/[ticker] (deal detail), /sheet-portfolio/[ticker]/options (options detail).
